cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, expected to pass just west of the Lower Florida Keys, then track northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico and turn north toward the Florida Panhandle/northern Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect for the Florida Keys west of the Seven Mile Bridge to the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Florida Keys west of the Seven Mile Bridge to Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, Florida West Coast, Florida Panhandle, Alabama coast and portions of the northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with low (≤3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side near Jacksonville
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could produce 3–5 inches with isolated higher totals, leading to minor flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain bands and brief periods of reduced visibility for marine operations
